content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
### Extraction System at Position(x=-3.5, y=27.5)
Consists of:
– Burner inserter at Position(x=-3.5, y=27.5) with drop position Position(x=-3.5, y=28.5)
Use-case: Feeds raw extracted materials into the subsequent belt connections.

### Copper Cable Factory at Approximately Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
Consists of:
– Cable factory input chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
– Factory burner inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5) (direction RIGHT)
– Ancillary factory burner inserter at Position(x=2.5, y=16.5) (as indicated by neighbour links)
– Assembling machine at Position(x=1.5, y=19.5)
Use-case: Processes raw copper plates into copper cable components.

### Belt Depot Extraction Structure at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
Consists of:
– Depot wooden chest placed at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5) serving as an isolated belt depot
– Adjacent transport belt segment at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5)
– Depot burner inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5) (using direction UP; with pickup at (3.5, y=15.5) and drop at (3.5, y=13.5))
Use-case: Acts as the intermediate belt target that receives materials (routed from the extraction system) for further processing.

### Electricity Generator at Position(x=-0.5, y=24.5)
Consists of:
– Steam engine (Generator) at Position(x=-0.5, y=24.5)
– Boiler at Position(x=-5.5, y=24.0)
– Offshore pump at Position(x=-7.5, y=25.5)
Use-case: Provides the power required to run factory processes and connected systems.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Transport Belt Connection Error  
 – When connecting transport belts, do not target a Prototype.SteamEngine directly. Always use an intermediary inserter to feed items into the steam engine’s input.

• Placement Distance and Inventory Errors  
 – Ensure the target placement position is within the permitted range of the player’s current position (within 10 units).  
 – Verify that the required item (for example, a wooden chest) is available in the inventory before attempting placement.

• Variable Reference Error  
 – Double-check that all variable names used (such as for the target chest) are defined correctly to avoid NameError exceptions.
